A11y Evaluation Audit (AEA) Report

This product has undergone a rigorous evaluation, employing the DHS Trusted Tester process alongside a meticulous manual assessment, ensuring a thorough examination conducted by an A11y Developer.

This meticulous process not only verifies the ADA Compliance status but also provides a detailed outline of any identified accessibility issues. The resolution of compliance issues will be diligently documented and addressed in a timely manner, with comprehensive updates included in the subsequent scheduled audit.

Our commitment to maintaining the highest standards of accessibility aligns with our dedication to delivering a product that meets compliance requirements and exceeds user expectations.

Review Date: Sun Feb 26 2023 16:54:41 GMT-0700 (Mountain Standard Time)

Product Information

Product Name: Kaﬀeinated Kodemonkey
Product Version: Version 2.0
Product Owner/Vendor: Heather Welsh
Product Type: Custom developed web page
Location: kaﬀeinatedkodemonkey.com
Product Description: Website for web a11y services

Tester's Information

Tester's First Name: Heather
Tester's Last Name: Welsh
Trusted Tester ID: TT-2311-03604
Company Name: Kaﬀeinated Kodemonkey
Tester's Email: a11y@kaﬀeinatedkodemonkey.com
Notes: Testing for WCAG Level AA.

Testing Environment

Browser: Chrome , Firefox
Browser Version: 105-110, 102-114
Operating System: Ubuntu
Testing Method: Trusted Tester
Testing Method Version: v.5.1.1

Testing Tools

  • Reporting Tool: A11y Evaluation Audit (AEA)
  • Automatied and AIP: WAVE and PopeTech
  • Sccreen Reader and Magnifier: Orca
  • Browser Extention: Accessibility Insight
  • Contrast Checker: Color Contrast Checker

Terms used in the Conformance Level

  • Supports: Functionality has one method that meets the criterion without defects
  • Does Not Support: The majority of product functionality does not meet the criterion
  • Not Applicable: The criterion is not relevant to the product
  • Not Evaluated: Not evaluated against criterion. This can only be used in WCAG 2.x Level AAA

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) Report

1.2.1 Does Not Apply Level A 1.2.1-audio-transcript-text. there is no pre-recorded audio-only content.

Disability Impact Score

The risk score is calculated by assigning one point to each disability type impacted by a failed Test ID. Disability groups with higher points have a higher risk of not being able to utilize the application. Projects should confer with the Certiﬁed Trusted Tester Accessibility Developer that performed the testing and their Component Section 508 Program Manager about remediating failed Test IDs before the application is released.

Risk Score: 0

Disability Group Risk Score Detailed Impacted Groups (with Score)
Vision 0 Without Vision (0), With Limited Vision (0), Without Perception of Color (0)
Hearing 0 Without Hearing (0), With Limited Hearing (0)
Cognitive 0 With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities (0), Without Speech (0 )
Photosensitivity 0 Photosensitive Epilepsy / Photosensitive Seizure Disorders (0)
Mobility 0 With Limited Manipulation (0)

Always Remember

Automated testing does not replace manual testing. Only a human can determine if a website is ada compliant.
The combination of a Certifed A11y developer and an A11y Platforme will set your team and project apart form others.

Join the Inclusive Web Movement Today!

Are you ready to make the internet a more inclusive and accessible place for everyone? Join us in our mission to create a web that leaves no one behind. Explore our services, become ADA compliant, and advocate for a more inclusive digital world.

Why Act Now?

  • Ensure your website complies with accessibility standards.
  • Reach a broader audience and potential customers.
  • Make a positive impact on the lives of people with disabilities.
  • Stay ahead of accessibility regulations and legal requirements.

Mission Statement

Kaffeinated Kodemonkey's mission is to make the digital world inclusive by ensuring accessibility for all.

We help businesses achieve ADA compliance and mentor the next generation of A11y developers, shaping a future centered on digital inclusivity.
